Package lib

Class VolumeModel

java.lang.Object
lib.VolumeModel
public class VolumeModel extends Object
A remote for a sound system have many different Volume controls. Volume can be increased to make the system louder. There will be a maximum volume to save the users' ears. There will be a mute function to stop sound at one button press.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    VolumeModel()
    Default constructor that creates a max volume of 10, a normal volume of 5 and sets mute to false.
    VolumeModel​(int maxVolume)
    Creates a volume model with the given maxVolume.
    VolumeModel​(int volume, int maxVolume, boolean muted)
    Creates volume model with a set volume, max volume and muted.

  • Constructor Details

    • VolumeModel

      public VolumeModel()
      Default constructor that creates a max volume of 10, a normal volume of 5 and sets mute to false. The die is rolled to give a random initial score.

    • VolumeModel

      public VolumeModel​(int maxVolume)
      Creates a volume model with the given maxVolume. The volume is set to half of the maxVolume. The muted variable is set to false
      Parameters:
      maxVolume - will set the max volume which can't be lower than 0.

    • VolumeModel

      public VolumeModel​(int volume, int maxVolume, boolean muted)
      Creates volume model with a set volume, max volume and muted. If the app is muted then the volume is set to 0.
      Parameters:
      volume - need to be less than or equal to max volume and cannot be lower than 0.
      maxVolume - cannot be lower than 0.
      muted - can only be true of false.

  • Method Details

    • setVolume

      public void setVolume​(int volume)
      Set the current volume of the volume controller.
      Parameters:
      volume - can only be set up to the maximum volume defined. This cannot be lower than 0.

    • setMuted

      public void setMuted​(boolean muted)
      Set the state of the muted function for the volume controller.
      Parameters:
      muted - can only be true of false.

    • turnUp

      public void turnUp()
      Increase the current volume of the volume controller Can only be increased up to the maximum volume

    • turnUpBy

      public void turnUpBy​(int vol)
      Increase the current volume of the volume controller by a set amount
      Parameters:
      vol - can only increase the volume up to the maximum volume value.

    • turnDown

      public void turnDown()
      Decrease the current volume of the volume controller. Can only be decreased down to 0 as the lowest value.

    • turnDownBy

      public void turnDownBy​(int vol)
      Decrease the current volume of the volume controller by a set amount
      Parameters:
      vol - can only decrease the volume down to 0 as the lowest value.

    • getVolume

      public int getVolume()
      Returns the current volume of the Volume Controller.
      Returns:
      the current volume of the Volume Controller.

    • getMaxVolume

      public int getMaxVolume()
      Returns the maximum volume of the Volume Controller.
      Returns:
      the maximum volume of the Volume Controller.

    • isMuted

      public boolean isMuted()
      Returns the true if the Volume Controller is muted. Returns the false if the Volume Controller is not muted.
      Returns:
      the the current state of the muted function of the Volume Controller as a boolean (True/False).

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a textual representation of the volume controller.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      a textual representation of the volume controller.
